QuestionStatement: A cartel is difficult to maintain for which of the following reasons?
AnswerChoices: Consumers substitute away from the good when the price increases
Individual cartel members are tempted to cheat on the agreement
Although the total gain to cartel members is positive, all members lose when everyone sticks to the agreement
Some firms will reduce output in an effort to lower costs of production
Oligopolistic behavior is generally predictable

QuestionStatement: Economists argue that most professional athletes earn economic rent because they
AnswerChoices: Make additional income through commercial endorsements of products
Are able to participate in sports for only a limited number of years before changing occupations
Earn far more as professional athletes than they could earn in their next-best occupation
Participate in sporting events only about six months during a year
Work less than 40 hours a week during the sport season

QuestionStatement: For the firm shown in the graph above, which combination of output and price will maximize its profit?         Output       Pricea.      Q1            P4b.      Q1            P1c.      Q2            P3d.      Q2            P2e.      Q3            P2
AnswerChoices: See above
See above
See above
See above
See above

QuestionStatement: A monopolist is inefficient from society’s point of view because
AnswerChoices: It overproduces output and charges a price above marginal cost
It underproduces output and charges a price above marginal cost
It sometimes colludes with other firms to obtain higher prices
The price the monopolist charges is too low and it does not advertise
Consumers must pay whatever price the monopolist charges

QuestionStatement: Suppose that at the current output level the marginal social cost of producing a good is greater than its marginal private cost, and that the marginal social benefit associated with production of the good is equal to its marginal private benefit.  Which of the following government actions would most likely increase efficiency?
AnswerChoices: Taxing the production of the good
Taxing the production of substitute goods
Giving tax rebates to people who purchase the good
Giving tax rebates to people who purchase the good
Subsidizing consumption of the good

QuestionStatement: Suppose that in one week Sam can knit 5 sweaters or make 4 blankets and Rob can knit 10 sweaters or make 6 blankets.  Which of the following is true?
AnswerChoices: Sam has an absolute advantage in making blankets
Sam has an absolute advantage in knitting sweaters
Sam has a comparative advantage in making blankets
Sam has a comparative advantage in knitting sweaters
Sam has neither a comparative nor an absolute advantage in knitting sweaters or making blankets

QuestionStatement: If the market depicted in the diagram above is initially in equilibrium, which of the following will result from the government’s setting a price ceiling at P3?
AnswerChoices: Quantity demanded will exceed quantity supplied
Quantity supplied will exceed quantity demanded
Market price will increase
Market price will be unaffected
Market price will decrease

QuestionStatement: An increase in the supply of coffee could be caused by
AnswerChoices: A decrease in the price of cream, which is a complement to coffee
A decrease in the cost of labor used to produce coffee
An increase in consumer income
An increase in the demand for coffee
An increase in the price of coffee

QuestionStatement: Which of the following explains why a decrease in the price of a normal good will lead to an increase in the quantity demanded of the good?
AnswerChoices: A lower price will increase consumers’ purchasing power
A lower price will increase consumers’ marginal utility
A lower price will increase demand for the good
A lower price will increase demand for substitute goods
A lower price will decrease demand for complementary goods

QuestionStatement: If SteveR Incorporated in a monopolistic producer of diamonds, the firm’s demand curve is downward sloping because
AnswerChoices: The number of diamonds SteveR Incorporated offers for sale affects the price of diamonds
Marginal revenue is negative throughout the range of the demand curve
Marginal revenue is positive throughout the range of the demand curve
The diamond industry consists of a few firms selling similar diamonds
The demand for diamonds is inelastic

QuestionStatement: Over the past 5 years, 50 new restaurants have opened and 30 have closed in the city of Zuni.  Currently there are 110 restaurants operating in the city.  Which of the following best represents the market structure, barriers to entry, and economic profits in the long run?            Market Structure            Barriers to Entry       Long-Run Economic Profitsa.      Perfect Competition            low                  negative      b.      Perfect competition                        high                  positivec.      Monopolistic competition            low                  zerod.      Monopolistic competition            high                  positivee.      Monopolistic competition            high                  zero
AnswerChoices: See above
See above
See above
See above
See above

QuestionStatement: For a perfectly competitive firm, increasing cost industry, an increase in the industry’s demand will lead to which of the following in the long run?
AnswerChoices: An upward shift in each firm’s long-run average cost curve
An increase in each firm’s profit
A decrease in the price of an input and a decrease in total industry profits
A decrease in total industry sales
A decrease in total producer surplus and an increase in total consumer surplus

QuestionStatement: If a good is available free of charge, an individual will consume it until
AnswerChoices: Marginal utility is zero
Average utility is zero
Total utility is zero
Marginal utility equals average utility
Marginal utility equals total utility

QuestionStatement: If a competitive firm pays its workers the value of the marginal product of the last worker hired, which of the following is true?
AnswerChoices: The firm will not earn any economic profits
Workers will look for employment elsewhere
The wage will be less than the marginal product
The firm will not maximize profits
The contribution of the last worker hired to the firm’s profit will be zero

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is necessary for a firm to practice price discrimination?
AnswerChoices: The government strictly enforces antitrust laws
The firm is a member of a cartel
The firm can prevent resale of its goods
The demand curve for the product is perfectly inelastic
The demand curve for the product is perfectly elastic

QuestionStatement: A monopolistically competitive firm’s demand curve will be highly elastic if which of the following exists?
AnswerChoices: A high degree of product differentiation
A highly elastic supply curve for the firm
High barriers to entry in this industry
A high degree of product substitutability
A small number of competitors

QuestionStatement: Country A has a Gini coefficient of 0.5, and Country B has a Gini coefficient of 0.3.  Which of the following statements is definitely true?
AnswerChoices: Country A has higher average income than Country B
Country B has higher average income than Country A
Income is more evenly distributed in Country A than in Country B
Income is more evenly distributed in Country B than in Country A
Country A has more deadweight loss than Country B

QuestionStatement: If labor is the only variable input of a firm and the marginal product of labor is falling, the firm will always produce
AnswerChoices: More than the profit-maximizing level of output
Less than the profit-maximizing level of output
At a level of output where average total cost is at a minimum
At a level of output where marginal costs are rising
At a level of output where average variable costs are falling

QuestionStatement: The graph above shows the conditions that a monopsonist faces in a labor market.  How many workers would this monopsonist hire, and what wage rate would it pay?# of Workers        Wage Ratea.      5                 $37.50b.      10                 $30c.      10                 $20d.      14                 $24e.      14                 $37.50
AnswerChoices: See above
See above
See above
See above
See above

QuestionStatement: Public goods are underproduced in a competitive market because the free rider problem causes which of the following?
AnswerChoices: Fixed supply
Effected price ceilings
Reduced market demand
Negative externalities
Increased imports
